text: The Hindenburg Line or Siegfried Position (German: ) was a system of forts built by the German Empire along the Western Front (World War I) during the winter of 1916-1917 to defend against France. After the war, the French built the similar but more elaborate Maginot Line to defend against Germany. Category:Battles of the Western Front (World War I) Category:Fortification Category:World War I Category:Buildings and structures completed in the 20th century
title: Hindenburg Line
